document.heading: D.C. Income and Franchise Tax Conformity Amendment Act of 1984

history.narrative: Law 5-147, the “D.C. Income and Franchise Tax Conformity Amendment Act of 1984,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 5-510, which was referred to the Committee on Finance and Revenue. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on October 23, 1984 and November 7, 1984, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on November 29, 1984, it was assigned Act No. 5-211 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
